intro: Dissochaeta ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, oval-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Dissochaeta ovalifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
